title: Mozilla Firefox failing as a browser on many levels. I find myself having to switch to safari or chrome to complete transactions.
content:
bold textMozilla Firefox failing as a browser on many levels. It's been my default browser for years. I am now having to switch to safari or chrome to complete transactions & for basic utilization of websites where there was not a problem before.

Firefox 105.0.3 MacOs Monterey Version 12.6
creator: josleed

title: Printing pages from the Bendigo Bank home banking is not working properly since last week
content: At work I always log on to the Bendigo Bank to look at transactions on our bank account. I need to print them off once a week. Since last week the pages don't print properly. Instead of showing the entire transactions, they are now half covered because the left hand side of the print page is covered by the bank's menu which always shows at the side of the webpage. I contacted the bank who said they'd had other firefox users complaining about this. They said that it's firefox's fault and follows an update which was done. Please can you help? I have attached a snipping tool image of the problem.
creator: fncv

title: Firefox crashed in the background
content:
bp-bd2f34a0-15bd-439f-a23a-247310221010


Firefox crashed in the background.


Recently, the browser will crash after being opened for a period of time (usually in the background). (The pages visited contain many pictures)
creator: aroundight.k

title: Incompatibility
content:
Macquarie Bank says its website is incompatible with Firefox and that I must change my browser to Google Chrome.

When I try to log on it often returns "An error has occurred. Oops, something went wrong. "

Their help desk advise that I can try cleaning up my junk files to make it work, but the fix is temporary. This log-on failure can happen several times a day, so that is not a workable option.

Perhaps it would be easier to change my bank!

Any suggestions?
creator: lynne14

title: you stopped me from playing with Crystal island on my Facebook account
content:
Did Not Connect: Potential Security Issue

Firefox detected an issue and did not continue to int01crystal.qublixgames.com. The website is either misconfigured or your computer clock is set to the wrong time.

It’s likely the website’s certificate is expired, which prevents Firefox from connecting securely. If you visit this site, attackers could try to steal information like your passwords, emails, or credit card details.

What can you do about it?

The issue is most likely with the website, and there is nothing you can do to resolve it. You can notify the website’s administrator about the problem.

Learn more…

j.o.hobbs@hotmail.com
creator: j.o.hobbs

title: Not able to access Fred Meyer or Kroger web pharmacy online sites due to pop ups and add blockers!
content: Not able to access fred meyer or kroger pharmacy web sites due to pop ups and add blockers for 2 weeks now... I changed password but still not able to get in? What to do?

title: My laptop is broken and I want to get back all of the markers I had on it. Can I access to them?
content: Well, my laptop is broken and I have no intention on fixing it (the motherboard got damaged so...), but I would like to access to the markers I had on it, can I get them back? What I think it would make it difficult is that I didn't have an account with Mozilla (I just created this) and therefore I didn't had Mozilla Sync. But hope is the last thing you lose. Any data or information to make it possible I'll have it available. Thanks.
creator: rodarte_landeros

content:
old account lsatenstein@yahoo.com was hacked, no longer have access. I was required to create a New account, which I did and it is satensteinl@yahoo.com

(initial moved from front to back of logonid.

How can I have Firefox.com correct my registration to convert the original logon name (yahoo.com blocks all access with a 550-30 code) to the new logon id. I can provide passwords that I used...
